title: Spotlight on Neshaminy's Harmon Yalartai
text:
Rick O'Brien, Inquirer Staff Writer Posted: Friday, October 23, 2015, 3:01 AM 
Yalartai's strength and aggressiveness at defensive end has helped the Redskins (5-2 overall, 3-1 Suburban One League National Conference) limit league foes to an average of 12 points per game. 
The 6-foot-1, 260-pound senior, who also sees time at tight end, has registered 31 tackles, with 22 solos, in seven outings. He has notched a team-high seven sacks. 
"Harmon is a terrific young man, always has a smile on his face, and he has a great attitude," Neshaminy coach Steve Wilmot said. "We build our run defense around him." 
Yalartai made seven stops, including five solos, in last week's 21-10 win over National Conference rival Souderton. More coverage
